lesson_title: Prepositions (In, On, Under, etc.) - More Examples
objectives: Understand what prepositions are and how they are used
Use prepositions to talk about place, time, and direction
Learn to avoid common mistakes with prepositions

topics.title: More Examples of Prepositions of Place

sections.text: Here are more examples of prepositions used to describe a place or position, each within a full sentence.

examples.label: Example for 'In'
examples.value: The farmers are working in the field.

examples.label: Example for 'In'
examples.value: My books are in my school bag.

examples.label: Example for 'On'
examples.value: A crow is on the tree branch.

examples.label: Example for 'On'
examples.value: The clothes are drying on the rope.

examples.label: Example for 'Under'
examples.value: We sat under the banyan tree for shade.

examples.label: Example for 'Under'
examples.value: The river flows under the bridge.

examples.label: Example for 'Over'
examples.value: She put a cloth over the basket of fruits.

examples.label: Example for 'Over'
examples.value: The airplane flew over our heads.

examples.label: Example for 'Beside'
examples.value: The small shop is beside the temple.

examples.label: Example for 'Beside'
examples.value: The puppy walked beside its mother.

topics.title: More Examples of Prepositions of Time

sections.text: Here are more examples of prepositions used to describe time, each within a full sentence.

examples.label: Example for 'At'
examples.value: The birds sing loudly at sunrise.

examples.label: Example for 'At'
examples.value: At the end of the day, we go home.

examples.label: Example for 'In'
examples.value: The old temple was built in the 15th century.

examples.label: Example for 'In'
examples.value: We collect water in the monsoon season.

examples.label: Example for 'On'
examples.value: The market is open on Fridays.

examples.label: Example for 'On'
examples.value: India became free on August 15, 1947.

examples.label: Example for 'During'
examples.value: Many people visit the village during the festival.

examples.label: Example for 'During'
examples.value: The children were quiet during the prayer.

examples.label: Example for 'For'
examples.value: The well has been dry for a long time.

examples.label: Example for 'For'
examples.value: He has been learning English for six months.

topics.title: More Examples of Prepositions of Direction

sections.text: Here are more examples of prepositions used to show direction or movement, each within a full sentence.

examples.label: Example for 'To'
examples.value: The path leads to the river.

examples.label: Example for 'To'
examples.value: My father sent a letter to my uncle.

examples.label: Example for 'From'
examples.value: I learned this lesson from my teacher.

examples.label: Example for 'From'
examples.value: We heard a loud noise coming from the forest.

examples.label: Example for 'Into'
examples.value: The caterpillar changed into a butterfly.

examples.label: Example for 'Into'
examples.value: The farmers went into the field to work.

examples.label: Example for 'Out of'
examples.value: He made a toy out of wood.

examples.label: Example for 'Out of'
examples.value: The rabbit came out of its hole.

topics.title: More Examples of Common Preposition Combinations

sections.text: Here are more examples of common combinations with verbs, adjectives, and nouns, each within a full sentence.

examples.label: Verb + Preposition
examples.value: Listen to the birds singing.

examples.label: Verb + Preposition
examples.value: We must care for old people in our village.

examples.label: Adjective + Preposition
examples.value: The bucket is full of water from the well.

examples.label: Adjective + Preposition
examples.value: My father is proud of my elder brother.

examples.label: Noun + Preposition
examples.value: What is the reason for your sadness?

examples.label: Noun + Preposition
examples.value: There is a great need for clean water in the village.

examples.label: Verb + Preposition
examples.value: I agree with your idea to clean the pond.

examples.label: Adjective + Preposition
examples.value: Our village is known for its sweet mangoes.

examples.label: Noun + Preposition
examples.value: The lack of rain caused problems for the crops.
